content:
If Pyrrhos built a ship or tower but another hero emerged and killed the gods, and as a result, the flood, fire, or earthquake did not occur, then it's difficult to predict exactly what would happen to Pyrrhos.

Without the cataclysmic events that forced Pyrrhos to build the ship or tower, he may not have gained the same sense of purpose or faith that he had in the original story. He may have gone on to live a normal life or become involved in different events and experiences.

Alternatively, if the hero who killed the gods was someone Pyrrhos admired and supported, he may have become an ally to that hero and joined them in their quest. On the other hand, if Pyrrhos was loyal to the gods and saw the hero as a threat to their authority, he may have opposed them and worked to protect the gods instead. Ultimately, it would depend on the specific circumstances of the new story and Pyrrhos's own beliefs and values.
